DataElement.preferredName: Reuse Template Until Repeat Activity Rule Cessation Delay Quantity ISO21090.URG.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The length of time that should elapse after the observed result occurs and before the cessation of repeating the activity. EXAMPLE(S): Stop 20 days after the observed event occurs.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Reuse Template Until Repeat Activity Rule Cessation Delay Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Up to the point of some specific time or event.:Make or do or perform again.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.:A prescribed guide for conduct or action._A stopping.:Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
Up to the point of some specific time or event.
Make or do or perform again.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
A prescribed guide for conduct or action.
